document_data.name: Trough and Plough
document_data.mainbody: The '''Trough and Plough''' was a tavern in [[Buckralam's Starn]] during the midâ€“8{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Services: Villagers met there by evenings, generally.
document_data.History: Around {{yearlink|755}}, the [[Iron Fox]] evicted the [[Chauntea]]n priest [[Rarendon]] from the [[Shrine of the Sheaf]] near Buckralam's Starn, and announced to the villagers by evening at the Trough and Plough they were to have their services to Chauntea in the fields. He wrote a code of laws by noon the next day, nailing it to the establishment's door.
